attributes.action: Aftercare services for parents who have lost babies
attributes.additional_details:
In December 2012 we lost Charlie Arthur Curtis to Potters Syndrome after 19 minutes of life.

 Whilst in hospital the care we received was excellent, however once we stepped outside the hospital doors it was as if we had entered the 'Bermuda Triangle'. There does not appear to be a system that supports bereaved/grieving families.

Communication between services was non existent, and care which should have been delivered was not.

We want the government to ensure there is a coordinated package of aftercare for all families following the loss of a baby/child.
